nodes.text: An IoT based system using Node MCU and related sensors can provide integrated smart security and smart home automation that overcomes range and reliability drawbacks of existing short range wireless methods
Existing home automation methods (Bluetooth, ZigBee, GSM, voice systems) have limitations: short wireless range, unreliable message delivery, or sensitivity to noise
We implement a prototype where Node MCU hosts sensors and relays, Arduino UNO handles the OV7670 camera, and the system communicates over Wi Fi or cellular (3G/4G) to the user

The system combines dual functionality: smart security (intruder detection and image alert) and home automation (remote control of lights and fans), plus environment monitoring (temperature, humidity, air purity)

Primary hardware components include Node MCU (ESP8266 platform), Arduino UNO, IR motion sensor, OV7670 camera, MQ135 air quality sensor, DHT11 humidity and temperature sensor, relay board and smartphone interface
Motivation for using Node MCU and internet is to overcome Bluetooth and ZigBee short range limits and GSM message unreliability by using Wi Fi or cellular internet
Sensors and relays are connected to Node MCU; camera requires multiple analog pins so it is connected to Arduino UNO which interfaces with Node MCU and PC
Relays (5V 4 channel) controlled by microcontroller switch household appliances allowing remote on/off control via the internet
System user interface uses smartphone apps and email: alerts and sensor readings are viewable on the Blink app or via email; owner can send simple commands (e.g., press '1') to actuate appliances
When IR sensor detects motion, it triggers the microcontroller to activate the camera which captures an image of the entrance
Home automation is achieved by remote switching of lights and fans via internet connection, enabling long distance control and aiding handicapped and elderly users
Environment monitoring uses DHT11 and MQ135 to report temperature, humidity and air purity every second; high readings can trigger fans to remove contaminated air
Captured images from OV7670 are stored on a PC folder and automatically sent to the predefined user email as an alert stating a possible intruder
Prototype results are visible on the Blink app and the captured images are successfully emailed to the user, demonstrating the integrated security and automation functionality
Advantages of the system include low cost, minimal requirements, combined security and automation, long distance control, and utility for handicapped and aged people
Limitation: The IoT home automation system requires internet connectivity (though cellular fallback is possible); future work could port the implementation to platforms like Raspberry Pi
